title: Pad See Ew (Thai Stir Fried Noodles)

ingredients.raw: 200g / 7 oz dried wide rice stick noodles , or 15 oz / 450g fresh wide flat rice noodles (Sen Yai) (Note 1)
ingredients.name: wide rice stick noodles
ingredients.notes: dried, or 450g fresh wide flat rice noodles (Sen Yai)

ingredients.raw: 1 tbsp light soy sauce (or all purpose, Note 3)
ingredients.name: light soy sauce

ingredients.raw: 3 tbsp peanut or vegetable oil , separated
ingredients.name: peanut oil

ingredients.raw: 2 cloves garlic cloves, very finely chopped
ingredients.name: garlic

steps: Trim the ends of the Chinese broccoli and cut into 7.5cm/3" pieces.
Separate the leaves from the stems.
Cut thick stems in half vertically so they are no wider than 0.8cm / 0.3" thick.
Prepare noodles according to packet directions and drain, timing it so they are cooked just before using.
Mix sauce ingredients until sugar dissolves.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a very large heavy based skillet or wok over high heat.
Add garlic and cook for 15 seconds.
Add chicken and cook until it mostly changes from pink to white.
Add Chinese broccoli stems and cook until chicken is almost cooked through.
Add Chinese broccoli leaves and cook until just wilted.
Push everything to one side, crack in the egg, and scramble it.
Remove everything from the wok onto a plate, scraping the wok clean.
Return wok to stove, heat 2 tbsp oil over high heat until it starts smoking (HOT is key!).
Toss as few times as possible to disperse Sauce and make edges of noodles caramelise, about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes.
Quickly add chicken and vegetables back in, and toss to disperse.
